You can configure multiple Wi-Fi networks for one device with SureMDM, which allows users to switch between a limited number of pre-approved networks easily. 
Steps to configure multiple Wi-Fi networks on iOS devices
1. Login to SureMDM Web Console.
2. Click Profiles.
3. Select iOS  as the platform.
4. Click Add.
5. Select Wi-Fi Configuration and click on Configure.
6. Under Wi-Fi Configuration, click Add.
7. On the Wi-Fi Configuration prompt, enter SSID, Security Type, Password and enable Auto Join.
8.  Repeat steps 4 through 7 for configuring another Wi-Fi SSID.
9. Enter a name for the profile and save it.
Additionally, companies can also push SCEP certificate onto iOS devices for an extra level of security.
Steps to specify certificates and authenticate the device accessing your network
1. Under iOS MDM Profile, select Certificates.
2. Click Configure.
3. In the new prompt, enable Create Certificate Using SCEP , give a name and click Add.
4. Now, go to Wi-Fi Configuration. Give a name to the profile and click Add. On the Wi-Fi Configuration prompt, select the Security Type as EAP/TLS. Check Certificate-Based Authentication checkbox. Click on Add Certificate to select the created certificate and click Save.
5. Click Save.
Steps to apply profile on an iOS device
1. On the SureMDM Home page, select the device or group of devices and click Apply.
2. Click Apply to apply the created job or profile to the device.
Once this is configured, users just have to select and click the Wi-Fi network they want to connect to whenever they need to access an alternate network. The device will automatically connect.
Ensure business devices are always connected to a secured network with SureMDM.  Try this feature (and many others) in SureMDM for free.

articles.title:
How to troubleshoot SureMDM Agent Offline Issue On Xiaomi MI Devices?	

			There are some cases when enrolled Xiaomi MI mobile devices go offline on SureMDM Web Console even when the device...
articles.description: How to fix the recent issue of Xiaomi MI mobile devices going offline on SureMDM Web Console even when the device has internet connectivity.

content_sections.text: How to troubleshoot SureMDM Agent Offline Issue On Xiaomi MI Devices?

Contents 
Steps to enable apps battery usage on the deviceSteps to allow SureMDM Agent to be active in the backgroundSteps to enable Auto start permission on the device
Steps to enable apps battery usage on the device
Steps to allow SureMDM Agent to be active in the background
Steps to enable Auto start permission on the device

There are some cases when enrolled Xiaomi MI mobile devices go offline on SureMDM Web Console even when the device has internet connectivity. This could be because of how Xiaomi MI mobile devices behave. When an application is dismissed from the screen and pushed to the background, these devices are programmed to kill the application after a certain period of time to avoid battery drainage.
There are following two solutions to enable SureMDM Agent to be active in the background on Xiaomi MI mobile devices even after it is dismissed from the screen.
Manage apps battery usageEnable Auto start permission
Steps to enable apps battery usage on the device
1. Launch Settings and tap Additional Settings.
2. Tap battery.
3. Tap Manage apps battery usage.
4. Then, tap Off.
Steps to allow SureMDM Agent to be active in the background
1. Launch Settings and tap Additional Settings.
2. Next, tap Battery option.
3. Tap Manage apps battery usage.
4. Tap Choose apps and select SureMDM Agent.
5. Then, tap Custom.
6. Now Enable Stay Connected option present under Background Network.
7. Then, enable Allow option present under Background Location.
Steps to enable Auto start permission on the device
1. Launch Security APP.
2. Tap Permissions option.
 3. Next, tap Autostart.
 4. Then, tap SureMDM Agent to give Autostart permission.
After configuring above settings, Xiaomi MI mobile devices going offline issue on SureMDM Web Console will be resolved.
For any extra technical assistance, please submit a ticket here.
Was this helpful?YesNo

articles.title:
How to simplify Windows 10 Device Management with SureMDM?	

			SureMDM offers unified security and management support for mobile devices across multiple OS platforms. Apart from Android and iOS support, SureMDM combines Windows...
articles.description: Read on to know how SureMDM combines Windows 10 and EMM offerings to enable adoption of Windows devices for enterprise use.

content_sections.text: How to simplify Windows 10 Device Management with SureMDM?

Contents 
PurposePrerequisitesStepsGet started and register devices to EMM Windows in SureMDMTo use EMM features for Windows in SureMDM
Prerequisites
Get started and register devices to EMM Windows in SureMDM
To use EMM features for Windows in SureMDM

SureMDM offers unified security and management support for mobile devices across multiple OS platforms. Apart from Android and iOS support, SureMDM combines Windows 10 and EMM offerings to enable the adoption of Windows devices for enterprise use.
Purpose
This article will guide the EMM features for Windows 10 Management and how admins can remotely configure and execute on enrolled devices.
Prerequisites
N/A
Steps
SureMDM support for Windows 10 desktops and mobile devices ranges from quick setup and configuration to remote security features.
Let’s quickly look at the top 4 features that will simplify management and help improve security on Windows 10 desktops and mobile devices.
Password Policy: Password Policies are a very basic and important aspect to be considered for the security of any mobile devices. SureMDM can be utilized to remotely lock and apply password policies on enrolled Windows devices. Email Configuration: Email account configuration on devices where the admin does not have physical access to the device, and configuration on Windows devices could be time-consuming and frustrating. SureMDM enables remote configuration of POP3 and IMAP4 email account on Windows 10 PCs and mobile devices.  Restriction Policy: There is a list of commonly exploited Windows features like Windows Store, storage, camera which make corporate information and device security vulnerable. SureMDM can remotely restrict these features from being accessed and used.  Wi-Fi Configuration: With employees constantly on the move from one network to another, it is very important to have a secure setup to help them connect to different Wi-Fi accounts. SureMDM enables admins to remotely configure Wi-Fi on Windows 10 PCs and mobile devices. 
Get started and register devices to EMM Windows in SureMDM
1. Launch Settings on a Windows device.
2. Search for Work and select Access work or school.
3. Click Enroll Only in device management.
4. Enter email address, followed by your MDM Server URL.

Example: yourcompany.suremdm.io



5. Enter Customer ID.
6. On successful enrollment, you will see the MDM Server connected to the Work or School account.
To use EMM features for Windows in SureMDM
1. Navigate to SureMDM Web Console.
2. On the SureMDM Home page, click Profiles.
3. Click Windows > Add.
Windows Profile page will list all the available EMM features for Windows 10 PCs and mobile devices.
SureMDM is equipped with advanced features which simplify management, help to secure Window 10 devices, and ensures that productivity levels will improve for your organization. Try SureMDM for free and explore the different features here. 
Click here to download SureMDM Agent for Windows.
Need help? CONTACT US

articles.title:
How to Create and Apply GeoFence Jobs in SureMDM	

			Geofencing lets administrators set a virtual boundary around places like offices or warehouses. They can then apply specific rules to...
articles.description: Learn how to create geofence for secure and efficient mobile devices using SureMDM.

content_sections.text: How to Create and Apply GeoFence Jobs in SureMDM

Contents 
PurposePrerequisitesSteps
Prerequisites

Geofencing lets administrators set a virtual boundary around places like offices or warehouses. They can then apply specific rules to devices as they come in or go out of this boundary. This simplifies device management and ensures security measures are in place.
Admins can configure jobs to be deployed on the devices when the user enters or exits this geographical  fence.
Purpose
The purpose of the article is to provide a guide on how to create a geo-fence job and push it to the enrolled device(s) remotely.
Prerequisites

Geo Fence requires GPS capability on the device. 
This feature will only function if the location permission is enabled on the device.
For now the GeoFence job is available for Android, iOS and Windows platforms.
Enable High Accuracy option for Location Tracking & Geo-Fence in the SureMDM console under Account Settings -> Miscellaneous Settings.

Steps 
1. Login to the SureMDM Console.
2. On SureMDM Home, navigate to Jobs and click on New Job.
3. On the Select Operating System screen, click Android or iOS.
4. On the Select Job Type screen, select Geo Fence.

5. On the Geo Fence prompt, select Enable Geo Fencing.
6. On the Select Fence tab, use Search option to go to a specific address

6. Click the Draw icon (located on the right of the map), place the cursor at the center of the location, and click and move the cursor until it covers the desired area. Click again to set the boundary. Once the location is marked, a prompt appears with Radius, Lat and Lng details.
7. Name the Geo Fence and click Save.

8. The newly created fence will show up under Fence Details.

Entering the Fence: Select Fence Entered tab, click Add to select the job(s) that will be activated on the device when it enters the fenced area and also specify if an alert has to be sent to the Device, MDM, or Email.

NOTE:  In the Select Jobs to Add screen, select the multiple jobs from the list using Ctrl key.  


Exiting the Fence: Select the Fence Exited tab, click Add to select the job(s) that will be activated on the device when it exits the fenced area at the specified end time, and also specify if an alert has to be sent to the Device, MDM, or Email.

9.  In the Job Details window, enter a Job Name.
The newly created job will be listed in the Jobs List section. 
10.. Go back to the Home tab and select the Android/iOS device(s) or group(s) and click Apply to launch the Apply Job/Profile To Device prompt.
11. In the Apply Job/Profile To Device prompt, select the job and click Apply.
The admins can select from the following options to receive an alert when the device enters the periodic fence:

Device: Alerts go directly to the device user’s mailbox, ensuring users receive specific notifications, keeping them informed and engaged with operational changes.



MDM: Alternatively, you can designate the SureMDM admin as the recipient of alerts. This ensures that notifications are directed to the centralized Inbox section within SureMDM



Email: You can choose an external email recipient for additional communication outside of the SureMDM platform. Alerts will be sent to the configured email addresses.


SureMDM’s geofencing simplifies how businesses manage devices, promoting efficiency and security. Especially beneficial for those with specific location needs, this feature ensures tasks activate seamlessly as devices enter or exit defined areas. It enhances precision and control, making mobile device management more effective across various scenarios.
Need help? CONTACT US 
Was this helpful?YesNo

Geofencing lets administrators set a virtual boundary around places like offices or warehouses. They can then apply specific rules to devices as they come in or go out of this boundary. This simplifies device management and ensures security measures are in place.
Admins can configure jobs to be deployed on the devices when the user enters or exits this geographical  fence.
The purpose of the article is to provide a guide on how to create a geo-fence job and push it to the enrolled device(s) remotely.
Prerequisites
Geo Fence requires GPS capability on the device.
This feature will only function if the location permission is enabled on the device.
For now the GeoFence job is available for Android, iOS and Windows platforms.
Enable High Accuracy option for Location Tracking & Geo-Fence in the SureMDM console under Account Settings -> Miscellaneous Settings.
1. Login to the SureMDM Console.
2. On SureMDM Home, navigate to Jobs and click on New Job.
3. On the Select Operating System screen, click Android or iOS.
4. On the Select Job Type screen, select Geo Fence.
5. On the Geo Fence prompt, select Enable Geo Fencing.
6. On the Select Fence tab, use Search option to go to a specific address

6. Click the Draw icon (located on the right of the map), place the cursor at the center of the location, and click and move the cursor until it covers the desired area. Click again to set the boundary. Once the location is marked, a prompt appears with Radius, Lat and Lng details.
7. Name the Geo Fence and click Save.
8. The newly created fence will show up under Fence Details.

Entering the Fence: Select Fence Entered tab, click Add to select the job(s) that will be activated on the device when it enters the fenced area and also specify if an alert has to be sent to the Device, MDM, or Email.
NOTE:  In the Select Jobs to Add screen, select the multiple jobs from the list using Ctrl key.

Exiting the Fence: Select the Fence Exited tab, click Add to select the job(s) that will be activated on the device when it exits the fenced area at the specified end time, and also specify if an alert has to be sent to the Device, MDM, or Email.
9.  In the Job Details window, enter a Job Name.
The newly created job will be listed in the Jobs List section.
10.. Go back to the Home tab and select the Android/iOS device(s) or group(s) and click Apply to launch the Apply Job/Profile To Device prompt.
11. In the Apply Job/Profile To Device prompt, select the job and click Apply.
The admins can select from the following options to receive an alert when the device enters the periodic fence:
Device: Alerts go directly to the device user’s mailbox, ensuring users receive specific notifications, keeping them informed and engaged with operational changes.
MDM: Alternatively, you can designate the SureMDM admin as the recipient of alerts. This ensures that notifications are directed to the centralized Inbox section within SureMDM
Email: You can choose an external email recipient for additional communication outside of the SureMDM platform. Alerts will be sent to the configured email addresses.

SureMDM’s geofencing simplifies how businesses manage devices, promoting efficiency and security. Especially beneficial for those with specific location needs, this feature ensures tasks activate seamlessly as devices enter or exit defined areas. It enhances precision and control, making mobile device management more effective across various scenarios.

articles.title:
How to Check SureLock Permissions Remotely?	

			As with most Android apps, SureLock requires users to accept a number of permission requests in order to properly function....
articles.description: Enable SureLock permissions to enable its advanced capabilities, such as disabling USB debugging or checking app usage trend on the device.

content_sections.text: How to Check SureLock Permissions Remotely?

Contents 
Steps to create and view a Custom Report in SureMDM
Steps to create and view a Custom Report in SureMDM

As with most Android apps, SureLock requires users to accept a number of permission requests in order to properly function. Following the steps below, you can generate a report in the SureMDM console to make sure that all the SureLock-equipped devices in your network have the proper permissions enabled.
Steps to create and view a Custom Report in SureMDM
1. Login to SureMDM Web Console.
2. Click Reports.
3. On the Reports screen, click the Custom Reports tab and click Add.
4. Provide a name and description for the report. (For example- Name: SureLock Permissions, Description: Checking to see if every device with SureLock has the proper permissions enabled) 

Example: Name: SureLock Permissions, Description: Checking to see if every device with SureLock has the proper permissions enabled



5. Under the Table List options, select the SureLock Checklist checkbox and add it to the list.
6. Click Save.
7. Click On Demand Reports and select the created report.
8. Select relevant devices or groups and click Request Report.
9. Click the View Reports tab to view or download the report.
A sample report:

 Once you have obtained the details you need from the custom report, SureMDM lets you remotely adjust SureLock settings on Android and Windows devices.
To try SureMDM for free click here.
To try SureLock for free, click here.

articles.title:
How To Add Youtube URL To SureVideo Playlist?	

			SureVideo has made streaming of YouTube videos on Android-based kiosks easier by an option to add YouTube video URL(s) to the playlist. Setps to...
articles.description: Use SureVideo to stream YouTube videos on Android-based kiosks by adding YouTube video URL(s) to the playlist.

content_sections.text: How To Add Youtube URL To SureVideo Playlist?

Contents 
Setps to add YouTube URL to SureVideo playlist
Setps to add YouTube URL to SureVideo playlist

SureVideo has made streaming of YouTube videos on Android-based kiosks easier by an option to add YouTube video URL(s) to the playlist. 
Setps to add YouTube URL to SureVideo playlist

1. Launch SureVideo.
2. Tap the screen 5 times within 3 seconds to launch password prompt.
3. Enter your SureVideo password to access SureVideo Settings.
4. Tap SureVideo Settings on Main Menu screen.
5. Tap Configure Playlist.
6. Tap Add Playlist.
7.  Tap Add Media File/Folder/URL.
8. Tap Add URL.
9. Type the YouTube video URL in the prompt and tap OK.
10. Exit SureVideo Settings, the specified YouTube video will start playing in kiosk mode.
This Add URL option in SureVideo can also be used if you have any videos hosted online with specific URLs.
To learn more about SureVideo and download a free trial, click here.

content_sections.text: How To Use Windows 10 Devices As Digital Signage?

Contents 
Steps to manually install SureVideoFor Desktops/TabletsFor PhonesSteps to remotely install SureVideoFor Desktops/TabletsFor Phones
Steps to manually install SureVideoFor Desktops/TabletsFor Phones
For Desktops/Tablets
Steps to remotely install SureVideoFor Desktops/TabletsFor Phones
For Desktops/Tablets

SureVideo offers multiple device support – Windows 10 desktops, laptops, tablets, mobile phones and offers following features:
loops selected videos in full-screen modevideo screensaverremote configuration including SureVideo installation and playlist compilationexport and import from Settings File for easy mass configuration
Let’s look at how we can install and get started with SureVideo for Windows.
Steps to manually install SureVideo

Note: To install AppxBundles, enable sideloading on Windows 10 devices using following steps:
Settings > Search for Developer Settings > Enable Sideload apps



For Desktops/Tablets
1. Download SureMDM Agent (Windows) and install the .exe file.
2. Download SureVideo – SureVideo.appxbundle and install the appxbundle.
3. Download SurevideoScreensaver.exe and install the .exe file.
For Phones
1. Download SureMDM Agent (Universal Windows App) and install the appxbundle.
2. Download SureVideo – SureVideo.appxbundle and install the appxbundle.
Click here to download the files.
Steps to remotely install SureVideo
For Desktops/Tablets
1. Download SureMDM Agent and install it on the desktop/tablet.
2. Configure Settings and enroll the device to SureMDM.
3. Go to SureMDM Web Console and create a new Install Job using following steps: 
Jobs > Windows > Install Application > Add New
4. Browse and select SureVideo.appxbundle, fill other details and click OK.
5. Follow step 3 and 4 to create another Install job with SureVideoScreensaver.exe.
6. Apply the created Install jobs to the device in the following sequence:
SureVideo.appxbundle
SureVideoScreensaver.exe
7. Once SureVideo is successfully installed, create SureVideo Settings job to remotely configure SureVideo using following steps:
Jobs > OS Type – Windows > SureVideo Settings > Add Raw XML data in Source field.
8. Make desired changes and click OK.
9. Go to SureMDM Home, use Apply to apply new settings on the desired Windows device
For Phones
1. Install NixUWP for Windows Phones.
2. Click Enroll Device > Enroll only in device management.
3. Set up the account and enroll the device to SureMDM.
4. Go to SureMDM Web Console and approve the device.
5. After Approving the device, the server details appear on the SureMDM Agent Home screen. This means that the Enrollment was successful.
6. Now, create an Application Policy Profile to install SureVideo remotely on the enrolled device using following steps:
SureMDM Home > Profiles > Windows  > Add > Application Policy > Add > Enter App Name and URL of the application for remote installation > Save
7. Now, create a Configuration Profile to configure SureVideo remotely using following steps and details:
Profiles > Windows  > Add > Configuration Profile > Add 
App Name – SureVideo
Key – Settings
Value – Edited with desired changes in Raw XML data
8. Now, create a PeriodicApp Launch Profile to configure screensaver remotely using following steps and details:
Profiles > Windows  > Add > Periodic App Launch > Configure > Add App Name and Periodicity to specify periodic launch of app.
9.  Once done, push the created Profiles to the device using Apply option on SureMDM Home in the following sequence:
Application Policy Profile
Configuration Profile
Periodic App Launch
10. On successful completion of listed steps, your Windows device would be ready as a Digital Signage.
With SureVideo setting up digital displays to play engaging video content at checkout counters, receptions, trade shows, store fronts or any other high-traffic areas is easy. The same set of features is also available for Android and iOS devices. Click here to read more about SureVideo.
Was this helpful?YesNo

loops selected videos in full-screen mode
video screensaver
remote configuration including SureVideo installation and playlist compilation
export and import from Settings File for easy mass configuration

4. Browse and select SureVideo.appxbundle, fill other details and click OK.

5. After Approving the device, the server details appear on the SureMDM Agent Home screen. This means that the Enrollment was successful.
6. Now, create an Application Policy Profile to install SureVideo remotely on the enrolled device using following steps:
SureMDM Home > Profiles > Windows  > Add > Application Policy > Add > Enter App Name and URL of the application for remote installation > Save
7. Now, create a Configuration Profile to configure SureVideo remotely using following steps and details:
Profiles > Windows  > Add > Configuration Profile > Add

10. On successful completion of listed steps, your Windows device would be ready as a Digital Signage.

content_sections.text: How to play videos at start-up on an Android device

Contents 
Purpose PrerequisitesStepsStep 1: To play videos at start-up on an Android device. Step 2: If you want a kiosk environment with a disabled bottom/system bar to play your videos and play them on start-up, follow these steps:
Prerequisites

StepsStep 1: To play videos at start-up on an Android device. Step 2: If you want a kiosk environment with a disabled bottom/system bar to play your videos and play them on start-up, follow these steps:
Step 1: To play videos at start-up on an Android device.
Step 2: If you want a kiosk environment with a disabled bottom/system bar to play your videos and play them on start-up, follow these steps:

Whether it is a trade show booth or an information kiosk at a mall, videos do say a lot more than standard static slides running on the display. SureVideo can help you achieve this with its simple setup and functionality. Download and install SureVideo on your Android tablet or Android Stick like any other Android application, and it will not only provide a secure environment for your device to be turned into a kiosk but will also enable you to play all standard and high-definition video formats full-screen for that required viewing experience.
Purpose 
The purpose of this knowledge article is to provide a guide on how to play videos at start-up on an Android device.
Prerequisites
NA
Steps
Step 1: To play videos at start-up on an Android device. 
1. Install and launch SureVideo.
2. Tap the SureVideo Home Screen five times within three seconds to launch the password prompt.
3. On the password prompt, Enter the SureVideo password. On successful login, the Main Menu screen appears.
4. On the Main Menu screen, tap the SureVideo Settings option.




5. On the SureVideo Settings screen, enable Run at Startup. 



6. Tap Done to complete.
Step 2: If you want a kiosk environment with a disabled bottom/system bar to play your videos and play them on start-up, follow these steps:
1. Install and launch SureVideo.
2. Tap the SureVideo Home Screen five times within three seconds to launch the password prompt.
3. On the password prompt, Enter the SureVideo password. On successful login, the Main Menu screen appears.
4. On the Main Menu screen, tap the SureVideo Pro Settings option.

5. On the SureVideo Pro Settings screen, enable the Enable Kiosk Mode option. Tap Done to complete.

Need help? 
CONTACT US

1. Install and launch SureVideo.
2. Tap the SureVideo Home Screen five times within three seconds to launch the password prompt.
3. On the password prompt, Enter the SureVideo password. On successful login, the Main Menu screen appears.
4. On the Main Menu screen, tap the SureVideo Settings option.




5. On the SureVideo Settings screen, enable Run at Startup. 



6. Tap Done to complete.
Step 2: If you want a kiosk environment with a disabled bottom/system bar to play your videos and play them on start-up, follow these steps:
1. Install and launch SureVideo.
2. Tap the SureVideo Home Screen five times within three seconds to launch the password prompt.
3. On the password prompt, Enter the SureVideo password. On successful login, the Main Menu screen appears.
4. On the Main Menu screen, tap the SureVideo Pro Settings option.

5. On the SureVideo Pro Settings screen, enable the Enable Kiosk Mode option. Tap Done to complete.

Need help?

The screen can be personalized with a watermark or logo using the Custom Watermark Settings option. This option will allow the user to select the desired image as...

content_sections.text: How to customize your own Watermark or Logo in SureVideo

Contents 
PurposePrerequisitesSteps
Prerequisites

Sometimes companies would like to display their logo or watermark in a video or image; with SureVideo, this can be easily achieved.
The screen can be personalized with a watermark or logo using the Custom Watermark Settings option.
This option will allow the user to select the desired image as a watermark or logo and place it in the desired position on the screen.
Purpose
The purpose of this article is to provide a guide on how to customize your own Watermark or Logo in SureVideo.
Prerequisites
This feature is not available in the trial version.
Steps
1. Enter SureVideo Admin Settings.
2. Tap SureVideo Settings and search for Custom Watermark Settings.

3. On this screen, in Custom Watermark Settings, select the desired image and position for the watermark to appear on the screen.


4. Users can select the Watermark Position from the following options.

4. Tap on Done, and you will have the desired Watermark/Logo on the screen.
END USER IMAGE:

Need help? CONTACT US
